title: Meaning of the $$n$$
text: The $$n$$ denotes the amount of components that the coefficient vector a should have.

title: Meaning of $$x_1$$ , $$x_2$$ ,..., $$x_n$$
text: The underscores of the $$x$$ denote the different components of $$x$$, which are multiplied by the coefficient vector by the dot product in order based on index value.

title: Dot Product
text: The dot product multiplies the corresponding components of the two vectors and adds them all together.

title: Reordering $$x$$ variables
text: To more easily calculate the coefficient vector, reorder the components of $$x$$ in the function to go from $$x_1$$ in increasing index.

title: Reordering Function Variables
text: What is the function rewritten so the $$x$$ indeces go from smallest to largest?

title: Expanded Dot Product
text: When the a and the $$x$$ are dot product multiplied, the resulting expansion is in the form $$a_1 x_1+a_2 x_2+...+a_{nx,n}$$. If there is no term for that index, the component in the coefficient vector is $$0$$.
